ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I need to know how to initiate a reaction in Cantera for a Batch Reactor. If I set ambient temperature as the initial temperature, the reaction does not

Subject: Initiating a reaction in a Batch Reactor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228646714; y=KtGaVGMP9WQ-NkaF5pmxZOlNNT0CE1g9gePEPOX6o0exvOHJSZygyeVTjx8

Hi,

I need to know how to initiate a reaction in Cantera for a Batch
Reactor.

If I set ambient temperature as the initial temperature, the
reaction does not take off. I tried modelling the fuel as 
CH4:0.9,
CH3:0.1, H:0.1 to begin a reaction. But I'm wondering if there's 
a
better approach for this.

In the case of my interest, my initial composition consists of a
mixture of air and fuel diluted by exhaust gases (an over
simplified case of exhaust gas recirculation). From some
calculations, I set the initial composition of gases. But since
the mixture is very dilute, the reaction does not take off even
with CH4:0.9, CH3:0.1, H:0.1 and hence I had to raise the initial
temperature. I had to put a temperature as high as 1800 to start
the reaction and to my surprise, that initial temperature value
doesn't even show up on the plots! I tried changing the time 
scale
to check if the high initial temperature could be seen, but it 
surely
did not show up in plots.


Thanks,

Bhupinder

--
Bhupinder Singh
Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
University of Florida
Gainesville
